description.narrative: (i) Environmental benefit: Upon full ramp-up for the Project, 233,000 tons of CO2 emission and 600,000 cubic meters of water is estimated to be reduced per year; (ii) SME access to finance: Upon full ramp-up for the Project, at least 44 SME borrowers will be financed. (iii) Demonstration effect: 1) encourage governments to participate in future public private partnership initiatives of this type, within and beyond China; 2) generate a broader market impact and demonstrate the viability of energy efficiency and water efficiency projects; and 3) catalyze financial institutions to offer sustainable energy/water financing to SMEs; (iv) Capacity building: (1) promote the improvement of industry-specific loan underwriting process/procedure and strengthen risk management practices; and (2) increase the Bank''s capacity to analyze and finance energy/water efficiency projects;

IFC is in discussion with Bank of Beijing (BOB or the Bank) to enter into an unfunded risk sharing facility (RSF) to support energy efficiency (EE), renewable energy (RE) and water efficiency (WE) projects with small and medium enterprises (SME) in China (the Project, or CHUEE SME BOB). In this proposed Project, IFC would take credit risk in a loan portfolio to be originated and funded by the Bank. The Project is expected to receive support from the Global Environmental Facility (GEF) and Chinese Central Government.
